item.title: Karen Karniol-Tambour on Today’s Economic Landscape
item.description: In a wide-ranging conversation with "The Money Maze Podcast," Co-CIO for Sustainability Karen Karniol-Tambour breaks down today’s challenging investing environment. Drawing on lessons from the past, she explores where investors can find inflation protection, China and the importance of geographic diversification, Bridgewater’s fundamental and systematic approach to sustainable investing, and much more.

item.title: Institutional Investor on Bridgewater’s Comeback and Successful Transition
item.description: An article published by Institutional Investor credits recent success to a series of structural changes to Bridgewater’s management and investment processes.

item.title: Bridgewater Launches Rising Fellows Program to Help Expand Investment Industry Diversity
item.description: The new Rising Fellows Program will be a three-week virtual experience with a focus on connecting with students from backgrounds underrepresented in the industry.

item.title: Bridgewater, Man: Clients Want More Than Money Management
item.description: In recent FundFire coverage, Chief Commercial Officer Kyle Delaney describes Bridgewater’s growing strategic partnerships with institutional investors.

item.title: Bridgewater Associates Launches Sustainable Investing Venture
item.description: Karen Karniol-Tambour and Carsten Stendevad to lead effort as Co-Chief Investment Officers for Sustainability.

item.title: Bridgewater’s Outdoor Office Solution Enables Face-to-Face Collaboration In a COVID-19 World
item.description: In the midst of a remote work environment, Bridgewater sought ways to allow team members to safely meet in person — to facilitate collaboration and benefit from the richness of face-to-face interactions. Our team responded by building a tented outdoor office space at our Westport, CT headquarters.

item.title: Rob Copeland of the Wall Street Journal Again Intentionally Distorts Facts About Bridgewater
item.description: Rob Copeland’s Wall Street Journal article, “Second Top Female Executive at Bridgewater Says Firm Paid Her Less Than Men,” was inaccurate because Copeland intentionally distorted the facts. We will share the facts of this case with you so that you can judge them for yourself.
